attributes.action: Make childcare affordable for working parents
attributes.additional_details: Childcare is so expensive in the UK, it’s one of the most expensive in the whole of Europe. I want the UK government to cap the cost of childcare and help parents afford to go back to work. It shouldn’t be a matter of is it worth it because of childcare cost, you should always be better off at work.
attributes.background: Cap the costs of childcare so that all parents, if they wish to do so, can return to work after having children

rejection.details:
The Government is not responsible for the cost of childcare. This is a matter for individual childcare providers, and deciding how much to spend on childcare is a matter for parents.

The Government already provides support for paying for childcare, and you can find out what support you can get here: https://www.gov.uk/childcare-calculator

We have published the following petitions calling for increased support for childcare costs, which you might like to sign:

Extend entitlements to free childcare for 2-year-olds to all working families: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/317697

Fund free childcare for key workers: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/314525

We could accept a petition calling for other changes to current support for childcare costs, but you would need to be clear what changes you want the Government to make.
